_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

A.     Introduction

Central Prairie Co-op's Sterling Hub Facility is a supplier of fertilizer, agrichemical, seed and other inputs to farmers. Bulk and packaged products are received via transport trucks and stored for the eventual sale to farmers. This facility has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to plant personnel or contractor's due to the RMP covered process. Sterling Hub Anhydrous Ammonia Bulk Storage Facility is brand new and there has not been an accident at any other Central Prairie Co-op Anhydrous Ammonia Bulk Storage Facilities in the last 5 years.

B.     Accidental Release Prevention Policies and Program

This facility strives to meet or exceed compliance with state anhydrous ammonia regulations. Training is provided for each new hire and re-hire employee and also and every three years as required by OSHA. The anhydrous ammonia tank(s) and associated equipment are inspected annually following recommended industry and engineering frequencies. Pressurized tank(s) and plumbing are tested according to the standards for the pressure vessel testing.

C.    Emergency Response Policies and Programs

Each employee is trained to be familiar with the emergency response policies and procedures through safety reviews and other safety meetings. This facility has an Emergency Plan which covers accidental releases, natural disasters, security incidents and other emergency response practices and procedures. The Emergency Plan for this facility is reviewed and updated on an annual basis as part of a comprehensive review process. The Emergency Plan for this facility includes specific instructions for the employees regarding the response procedures to an emergency. The procedures provided in the Emergency Plan are shared with all employees and followed in the event of an emergency. The local emergency planning committee and fire department personnel are furnished a copy of the Emergency Plan for this facility and invited for a to

ur on a regular basis.

D.    Worse-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario

This facility has developed a worse-case and an alternative-case scenario however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by EPA.

E.    Five Year Accident History 

Construction of the Sterling Hub facility began in 1988 and was completed in 1989. The Anhydrous Ammonia (Nh3) Plant is the most recent addition to the location which was completed November 6th 2017. The Sterling hub at this point doesn't have a 5-year accident history but Central Prairie Co-op overall, has an excellent safety record with no deaths or serious injuries to any of its employees resulting from any of our RMP covered processes. Through various forms of trainings, compliance, processes, and safety procedures, Central Prairie Co-op expects to continue working with Nh3 in a safe manner.

F.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Management of this company and facility continuously look for ways to enhance the safety of this location. Monthly safety inspections are conducted which result in corrective actions: annual equipment inspections are also conducted, and detailed environmental health and safety audits are conducted at least every three years.

G.    Summary

The employees of this company are extremely proud of our safety record and vast improvements made in both environmental stewardship and safety. We believe with our programs and policies in place and with the continued efforts of our personnel, we will maintain our safety record and our safe facility environment for the public, our customers and our employees for years to come.
